info.headline: Heat Advisory issued June 11 at 4:20PM AST until June 11 at 5:00PM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Prolonged periods of dangerously hot temperatures and high humidity likely with heat indices up to 111 degree Fahrenheit. * WHERE...Along the urban and coastal areas of San Juan and vicinity, the northeast, and St. Croix * WHEN...For the Heat Advisory, through 5 PM AST today. For the Excessive Heat Watch through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...The combination of hot temperatures and high humidity will create dangerous situations in which heat related illnesses are posible.
info.instruction: A Heat Advisory means that a period of hot temperatures is expected. The combination of hot temperatures and high humidity will combine to create a situation in which heat illnesses are possible. Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency, call 9 1 1.
